jobData.title: Software Developer - job post
jobData.description:
Company Description
TS Manufacturing, a local family-owned manufacturer of Automated Machinery for the Sawmill & Material Handling sector, based in the scenic City of Kawartha Lakes. As an industry leading manufacturer, TS Manufacturing has continually improved its facilities and infrastructure. With modern technology, and a strong global customer base we require people who are willing to take advantage of the opportunities to improve our processes and customer experiences throughout the organization including Software Developer. In this role, you will get the opportunity to work with customers on almost every continent worldwide; as well as occasionally interfacing with engineering staff at one of our 3 other facilities worldwide – including New Zealand, and North Carolina.
Job Description
The successful candidate will join our existing Optimization & Software Development teams based in Ontario; British Columbia and New Zealand working to deliver next generation software for the Wood Processing Industry. This fast paced development environment includes working with the latest in 3D Scanning and Vision technologies to provide high performance applications that augment the automated wood processing machinery developed at our headquarters and around the world.
Key Duties Include

 Develop and troubleshoot new software applications and features.
 Support installations both remotely and occasionally at customers’ premises
 Perform testing and debugging code
 Develop solutions to enterprise problems
 Prepare documentation and user manuals for applications

Desired Skills & Experience

 A Computer Science or Engineering Degree is preferred, although a diploma and relevant experience will be considered
 Experience developing software architecture for industrial environments for high performance and reliability
 Demonstrated ability with Test Driven Development
 Demonstrated experience developing asynchronous service level applications in C#
 Demonstrated experience developing user interfaces using ASP.NET, TypeScript, CSS3
 Exposure to Relational and Non-Relational Database development
 A clear communicator with English to a first language level
 Organized, self-regulated and excellent time management skills required.
 Able to travel within Canada and the United States

Strong Consideration will be given to Any Experience in :

 Exposure to the Principles of Three Dimensional Data Processing
 Problem Solving using GPU / APU based Technologies
 Professional Experience with Three.js
 Experience with ASP.NET Blazor

Work Location
Depending upon the successful candidates relevant experience and skillsets this role is available to be fulfilled in any of 3 regions :
Nanaimo, British Columbia and Surrounding Region
Kawartha Lakes, Ontario and Surrounding Region including the GTA
Depending upon the successful candidate’s qualifications this role may have opportunities for Work from Home or office based work.
Applicants are encouraged to view our website at www.tsman.com
What we Offer
Working with TS Manufacturing is a unique chance to take part in a growing company with projects all over the world. Our family oriented company ensures that you are not just a number, but a part of that family, where you are a part of an industry leading team of people working to provide innovative, responsive solutions to our customers unique needs.
All TS Employees are offered:

 An opportunity to be part of a fast-paced, energized and rewarding team environment
 Competitive Renumeration plans from Salary to Hourly depending upon role
 Company sponsored Pension Plan
 Health and Dental Benefits
 Company sponsored parties and social gatherings

Headquarters Locale
TS Manufacturing is located right in the centre of the Kawarthas. Just over 60 minutes to the GTA, and in close proximity to Hwy 115 and 401, Peterborough, Toronto, and all major Ontario Cities - they are easily within reach providing options for those who prefer the big city amenities, as well as those who prefer the small-town easy-going pace. For more information about Lindsay and the surrounding area, please visit http://www.explorekawarthalakes.com.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $85,000.00-$100,000.00 per year
Benefits:

 Company pension
 Dental care
 Disability insurance
 Extended health care
 Life insurance

Schedule:

 Day shift
 Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:

 Kawartha Lakes, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

Work Location: In person
